title: Dealing with imposter syndrome in engineering
author: Anonymous Student
content: I'm in my third year of computer science and constantly feel like I don't belong here. Everyone seems so much smarter than me. How do you deal with these feelings?

replies.author: Supportive Senior
replies.content: I felt exactly the same way! What helped me was realizing that everyone struggles, they just don't talk about it openly. You earned your place here.

replies.author: Study Buddy
replies.content: Try keeping a 'wins journal' - write down one thing you accomplished each day, no matter how small. It really helps shift your perspective.

title: Balancing work and studies - need advice
author: Working Student
content: I'm working part-time to support my family while studying. I'm exhausted and my grades are suffering. Any tips for managing both?

replies.author: Time Management Pro
replies.content: Time blocking saved my life! I schedule everything - work, study, even breaks. Also, talk to your professors about your situation. Many are understanding.

title: Homesickness in final year
author: Final Year Student
content: I thought I'd be over homesickness by now, but it's hitting hard in final year. Maybe it's the stress of graduation and job hunting?

replies.author: Graduate Mentor
replies.content: This is so normal! Final year brings up a lot of emotions about change and the future. It's okay to feel homesick even after years away.

replies.author: Peer Support
replies.content: I'm going through the same thing. Video calls with family help, and I've started a gratitude practice to focus on the positive aspects of this journey.
